intro: Crataegus pruinosa f. puberula, commonly known as the pubescent hawthorn, is a botanical variant of the common hawthorn. It is characterized by its finely hairy, pubescent surfaces on both the leaves and stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces white to pale pink flowers in early spring, followed by red berries in the autumn. It is typically found in woodland areas and thrives in well-drained soils. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits.
